Bio

Having been previously trained within clinical psychology, I find myself in possession of a rare profile of experiences and skills. Practicing within adult mental health services honed my communication skills, self- reflection and ability to tolerate difficult interpersonal dynamics. Taking time out to study computer science and software development taught me how to apply an analytical mindset in a more methodical way, forced me to develop ruthless patience in the face of difficult problems and started a passion for all things related to technology and programming.

Since I have been employed as a software developer, I have had ample opportunity to practice application design, debugging, refactoring, design patterns and clean coding practices. I am passionate about writing clean code that is both efficient algorithmically and easily understandable by humans.

Jun 2020 - Current

Appius International

Frontend Developer

Full frontend responsibilities, building pixel-perfect and responsive websites and UI with HTML5, CSS3/SCSS, JavaScript and Vue.js.

Mar 2020 - Jun 2020

Appius International

Web Developer

Designing and building software and modules within content management systems, leveraging .NET, Sitecore, and Sitefinity. Developing customer portals and integrations with 3rd party solutions, CRM, payment gateway and other RESTful interfaces and bespoke modules.

Sep 2019 - Mar 2020

School Business Services

Software Developer

Taking primary responsibility for the development of Quasar component and Vue.js based UI for existing and planned school budgeting software as it is migrated to .NET Core 3. With internal promotion within the company, over time the career path is proposed to become the primary point of consultation for design, architecture and implementation of client side software for SBS.

Apr 2019 - Sep 2019

School Business Services

Junior Software Developer

Development of the UI for a new financial planner greenfield project, under the supervision of Paulo Carvalho. Increasing knowledge of Vue.js, component libraries and Symfony4 MVC architecture.

Jul 2017 - Apr 2019

Home

Self-taught Web Development Student

Accumulated 1,500+ hrs in core JavaScript, HTML5/CSS3, Node.js and web technologies in general

Oct 2014 - Mar 2017

NHS

Cognitive Behavioural Therapist

Treating mild to severe cases of depression, complex depression, generalised anxiety disorder, social phobia, panic disorder, obsessive compulsive disorder, post-traumatic stress disorder, adjustment issues and general mental health difficulties. Some experience working with personality disorders.

Brief and extended assessment of all above in addition to triaging clients to the most appropriate service, screening for severe and enduring mental health disorders, referring to extensive services ranging from specialist counseling groups, eating disorder services, psychiatric teams, secondary care services and charitable sector organisations. Valued for joint and independent decision making.

Blending cognitive modification with behavioural changes, grounded in client-centred values and goals. Long-term mindfulness/meditation practitioner.

Oct 2010 - Oct 2014

NHS

Psychological Wellbeing Practitioner

Assessed, treated and managed a caseload of up to 38 weekly clients, delivering low-intensity cognitive behavioural interventions primarily over the telephone. Hired to reduce waiting list, facilitate group psycho- educational courses and help with service coordination. Acknowledged as experienced practitioner with broad knowledge base.

Provided help to clients with mild to severe anxiety/depression, phobias, obsessive-compulsive and sleeping disorders.

Oct 2010 - Oct 2014

NHS

Assistant Clinical Psychologist

Independent management of own diary and case load; behavioural and functional analysis, bespoke formulation and intervention; behavioural measurement and management; providing guidelines and advice; implementation of psychometric assessments; writing reports and maintaining client files; running therapeutic groups; and generic counselling and support to vulnerable adults with learning disabilities.
